intro: Lithops rubra, commonly known as the Cape Town flower, is a species of stone plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, leaf-like structures that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. The plant produces small, vibrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and white during the spring season. Lithops rubra is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to harsh climates. Its appearance resembles a rock, helping it blend into its natural surroundings for protection against herbivores.
